Construct state.text: In many languages there is a way of combining two nouns to produce a combination noun.

tokensOfLine.text: For example, in English I can say something is “The Bank Headquarters” and use “Bank” as an adjective even though it is a noun.
Common phrases like “post office” and “police station” use this construct form.
The construct form is called the “smichus” סמיכות in traditional grammar.
The construct form is contrasted with the absolute form, which is just a regular noun like “the apple.”
